title: Top Maoist leader among three killed in exchange of fire in A.P.’s  Maredumilli forest
content: The exchange of fire took place between the group of Maoists and the Greyhounds, the elite Anti Naxal Squad of the State police department.

title: Telugu expats in Israel on the edge but not ready to return to India
content: Many from Telangana and Andhra Pradesh are employed as caregivers to the elderly Israelis living alone

title: Bhadra reservoir ICC appeals to farmers on left bank not to grow water-intensive crop this kharif season
content: Bhadra dam authorities will be replacing the gate on the left bank canal, and the work will take one-and-a-half months to complete

title: Three judges of Madras High Court escape possible train derailment attempt
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar, G.K. Ilanthiraiyan and Krishnan Ramasamy were travelling in Yercaud Expres along with retired judges K. Kalyanasundaram and M. Govindaraj

title: Schools that hired drivers who failed alcohol test in Bengaluru to be questioned by police
content: 58 drivers, among the 4,559 who took the alcohol test in a three-hour-long campaign across Bengaluru, were found driving while under the influence of alcohol

title: Singapore-flagged cargo ship fire: Police file case against owner, captain and crew of MV Wan Hai 503
content: FIR says ship was navigated rashly in a way that could be dangerous to human life, despite the presence of flammable materials, chemicals, and explosives on the vessel

title: Mumbai's Powai Lake overflows after heavy rains
content: Having a storage capacity of 545 crore litres, the Powai Lake is not potable and is used only for industrial purposes.

title: TTD proposes to name Renigunta airport after Lord Venkateswara
content: A Lord Venkateswara temple to be built in Bengaluru; a CSIR lab to be set up in Tirupati to check the quality of material used in preparation of prasadam

title: Karnataka rains: Hemavathi dam shutters to be opened, alert issued
content: The crest gates could be opened any time as water level has been rising due to heavy rains in the catchment area

title: Goyal to discuss India-U.K. FTA implementation with British counterpart during 2 day London visit
content: The pact aims to eliminate duties on labour-intensive Indian exports such as leather, footwear and clothing, while easing imports of U.K. products like whisky and cars

title: IT, ITES sectors to benefit the most with 10-hour shifts
content: The amendment will legitimise the violation of working hours that is already happening in the sector, says the CITU

title: Karnataka proposes to increase daily working hours, overtime
content: The Karnataka government, in its draft amendment, has cited the Union government’s directions to all States to consider amending the working hour limits through legislative or regulatory changes appropriately

title: PM Modi leaves for Croatia after concluding Canada visit
content: In Kananaskis, Prime Minister Modi held “productive” exchanges with leaders of the seven-nation bloc on key global challenges and shared aspirations for a better planet.

title: What is IIT-Delhi’s quantum communications breakthrough? | Explained
content: After the event, defence minister Rajnath Singh said India had entered “a new quantum era of secure communication” that will be “a game changer in future warfare”

title: The third, non-political players in Tamil Nadu’s electoral battlefield dominated by Dravidian majors
content: Ever since the State politics began having duopoly, numerous parties and individuals had attempted to forge a viable alternative to the two principal players, the DMK and AIADMK. So far, success has eluded them.

title: India, Canada agree to restore High Commissioners, trade talks and other dialogues snapped over Nijjar killing
content: PM Modi meets Canadian PM Carney on side-lines of G7 outreach, agree to reset ties, Carney, G7 raise problem of Transnational  Repression

title: PM Modi meets world leaders on G7 margins; discuss bilateral ties, counter-terrorism
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi discuss bilateral ties, regional and global issues with his global counterparts on the margins of the G7 Summit in Kananaskis, Canada

title: S.K.Bhasha appointed as AP Chairman of Port Trust Workers Federation
content: Visakhapatnam Port Authority Chairman was urged to allocate office space for Andhra Pradesh State Unit of the All India Port Trust Workers Federation

title: When clash erupted between T.N. government and Governor on appointing a Vice-Chancellor 40 years ago
content: In 1985, during M.G. Ramachandran’s (MGR) tenure as Tamil Nadu Chief Minister, tensions simmered over Governor S.L. Khurana’s use of his authority to appoint Vice-Chancellors to State-run universities. A conflict arose in October when the Governor appointed S. Krishnaswamy as Vice-Chancellor of Madurai Kamaraj University.

title: AIMPLB members demands withdrawal of Waqf Amendment Act 2025
content: Assistant general secretary and State Convener of All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) and the AIMPLB district convener criticised the Central government for introducing the Waqf Amendment Act 2025 and said that they would continue to protest until the bill is repealed

title: CBI holds coordination meeting with DFS, public sector banks officials
content: During the meeting, detailed presentations were made by the CBI and Public Sector Banks officials on relevant operational issues

title: EAC holds meeting on Polavaram–Banakacherla Project
content: The panel is reviewing the proposal submitted by the A.P. government and will evaluate the environmental impact of the project

title: Delving into multiple layers of Tamil identity
content: Nirmala Lakshman, Publisher and Chairperson of The Hindu Group of Publications, spoke at a discussion in Bengaluru on her book The Tamils

title: Maharashtra doubles honorarium of Emergency-era prisoners
content: The Maharashtra cabinet on June 17, 2025, doubled the honorarium given to people from the state who were imprisoned during the Emergency. The cabinet also decided to add the names of spouses as a beneficiary

title: Calcutta HC orders interim stay on notification of OBC list in W.B.
content: On June 10, the West Bengal government tabled a new OBC list in the State Assembly with minor changes compared to the previous list. The Calcutta High Court in May 2024 had cancelled the OBC reservation awarded to 77 categories

title: Bihar Cabinet gives nod to sign MoU with AAI to develop six small airports under UDAN scheme
content: These airports would not only make air travel easier for the residents, but would also boost the State’s economy; PM Narendra Modi inaugurated Patna airport’s new terminal built at the cost of ₹1,200 crore

title: Father-son duo held for siphoning off ₹64 lakh from Indore court bank account
content: Accused from Gujarat allegedly exploited inactive mobile number linked to court’s SBI account; booked under BNS and IT Act

title: Telangana Teachers’ Eligibility Test to be held from June 18
content: With 66 centres in 15 districts, the computer-based test will be organised for paper-1 (candidates wanting to teach classes 1 to 5) and paper-2 (candidates wanting to teach classes 6 to 8)

title: ‘Lofty words, little action’: Telangana BJP takes aim at Revanth govt.’s performance over unfulfilled promises
content: Blaming the previous BRS government and former Chief Minister KCR for unpaid bills, accumulating debt is merely an “excuse” to mask Congress govt.’s “non-performance”, says BJP leader N.V. Subash

title: Telangana phone tapping case: TPCC chief Mahesh Kumar testifies before SIT, demands punishment for KTR, KCR
content: SIT is examining witnesses in connection with alleged illegal surveillance of overall 600 phone numbers, tapped at various points, including up until two months before the 2023 Assembly elections

title: Wherever Arogya Mandirs open, Mohalla Clinics will be pushed out: CM
content: Rekha Gupta says the Centre had sanctioned ₹2,400 crore in health grants for Delhi, assures to unveil over 1,100 AAMs by March 2026

title: Panthers relied on Marchand's 'magic' in Cup run
content: Acquired at the trade deadline from the Boston Bruins, forward Brad Marchand, 37, was a driving force behind the Florida Panthers' Stanley Cup run, which ended on Tuesday night at Amerant Bank Arena, where the Edmonton Oilers were eliminated in Game 6.

title: Bennett wins Conn Smythe after NHL-high 15 goals
content: Panthers forward Sam Bennett, who led the NHL playoff field with 15 goals, including five in the Final, was named the winner of the Conn Smythe Trophy on Tuesday night.

title: Clark, Fever to vie for Cup after scuffles mar win
content: Caitlin Clark and the Fever advanced to the Commissioner's Cup championship game after defeating the Sun in a physical game that included a pair of scuffles and three late ejections.

title: Ruggs apologizes to victim's family at Vegas event
content: Former Raiders wide receiver Henry Ruggs III, on special release Tuesday night, spoke at a Hope for Prisoners event in Las Vegas and apologized to the family of a woman he killed in a car crash nearly four years ago.

title: Lynx back in Cup final, but Collier exits with injury
content: The Lynx will try for their second straight Commissioner's Cup championship after advancing to the final Tuesday night, but star Napheesa Collier left early with a back injury.

title: Devers: Boston in past, will play where Giants want
content: Rafael Devers was formally introduced by the Giants on Tuesday, strolling into the clubhouse side-by-side with Barry Bonds. And whatever went wrong in Boston, Devers is done discussing any issues he had with the Red Sox and eager to move forward.

title: Yanks' bats 'in a little rut,' blanked in 3rd straight
content: The Yankees' scoreless innings streak reached 29 innings after Tuesday night's 4-0 loss to the Angels, which marked their fifth straight loss.

title: Sportsbooks divided on Cup favorite for 2026
content: Odds to win the 2026 Stanley Cup are already up at sportsbooks, and there is disagreement in the betting market regarding which team should be the favorite heading into the offseason.

title: 🏆 Reactions to Panthers' Stanley Cup win
content: The Florida Panthers secured the back-to-back Stanley Cup final wins on Tuesday night with a Game 6 win on home ice.

title: Updated NBA mock draft with movement in the top 10: How we see Rounds 1 and 2, eight days out
content: With the draft eight days away, Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo share the latest intel from around the league.

title: Let's lay out the Spurs' offseason options: Three potential trade offers to entice them
content: San Antonio strives to "build something that's sustainable," it has options, and we have three trade offers.

title: Spaun's stunning U.S. Open victory shakes up Ryder Cup race, plus favorites at The Open
content: Who will be the favorites in The Open? Will J.J. Spaun's unlikely victory propel him to more wins? With the U.S. Open finished, we look ahead in the 2025 season.

title: A wedding during the MCWS?! More than one ring is on the line for Louisville's Tanner Shiver
content: Louisville's Tanner Shiver is competing in the MCWS this week, but he's still planning on getting married Friday.

title: Inside Gage Wood's MCWS masterpiece
content: No hits, 119 pitches and one historic performance. Gage Wood was electric in his no-hitter for Arkansas.

title: First Betts, now Devers? Red Sox ownership under fire from fans -- again
content: John Henry & Co. traded another franchise icon. The only thing they can do to appease the Fenway faithful now? Win.

title: What Sunday's shocking trade means for the East, the KD saga and the NBA draft
content: The shocking deal has ramifications far beyond Orlando and Memphis -- including the Kevin Durant trade saga.

title: A transfer window already opened and closed: What did it reveal about new tactics?
content: The first transfer window has offered hints as to what Liverpool, Chelsea, others want to do differently.

title: 'We compromised the NBA Finals': How WCW capitalized on Rodman-Malone hoops rivalry
content: Marc Raimondi's excerpt from "Say Hello to the Bad Guys" looks at the nWo storyline involving two Hall of Famers.

title: Texas State, cryptic posts and the Pac-12's next move
content: Texas State looms as the favorite to join the Pac-12. Why could that happen? What would come next? And what about Memphis?

title: 'Secret love for soccer' put Freeman on U.S. path
content: United States and Orlando City SC fullback Alexander Freeman said he had a "secret love of soccer" growing up after not following the same sporting footsteps as his father, former NFL player Antonio Freeman.

title: FIFA: Nearly 1.5 million CWC tickets sold so far
content: Fans from over 130 countries have purchased nearly 1.5 million tickets for the Club World Cup that kicked off last weekend in its newly expanded format across the United States, FIFA said on Tuesday.

title: Pep signals Grealish's City exit: 'He has to play'
content: Pep Guardiola suggested on Tuesday that Jack Grealish should seek a new club to rekindle his passion for the game after two years on the sidelines at Manchester City.

title: Sergio Ramos, Monterrey secure draw with Inter
content: Champions League finalist Inter Milan was held to a 1-1 draw by Monterrey in their Club World Cup opener, with goals from Sergio Ramos and Lautaro Martínez.

title: Xabi expects 'instant impact' from TAA, Huijsen
content: Xabi Alonso praised the "instant impact" of Real Madrid signings Trent Alexander-Arnold and Dean Huijsen on Tuesday, calling the new arrivals "top players" ahead of the team's Club World Cup debut.

title: Sources: Williams, Eze among Bayern's targets
content: Rafael Leão, Nico Williams, Bradley Barcola and Eberechi Eze are among Bayern Munich's potential targets, sources told ESPN.

title: Spurs chief: Sacking Ange 'emotionally difficult'
content: Tottenham Hotspur chairman Daniel Levy has described the recent decision to sack former manager Ange Postecoglou as "emotionally difficult."

title: Washington signs Juve, Italy star Sofia Cantore
content: The Washington Spirit have acquired forward Sofia Cantore via transfer from Serie A side Juventus, making Cantore the first Italian international in NWSL history.

title: 👀 What it really means to 'get Concacafed'
content: This summer's Concacaf Gold Cup is sure to provide a lot of shenanigans, and not just for the USMNT. But what exactly makes North and Central American soccer so brutal and silly?

title: USMNT eases pressure with big win to open Gold Cup, but tougher tests ahead
content: Sunday's big win should relieve some pressure on a U.S. team that's been struggling for form and harmony of late. However, it's clear bigger tests are ahead at this Gold Cup and beyond.

title: An 11-year NBA veteran and the emergency transplant that saved his life
content: Sixteen months ago, Scot Pollard was in active heart failure, about to die. Then came a lifesaving transplant, uniting two families -- and two fathers -- forever. Watch E60's "Heart of Pearl" at 1 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: McLaren's Montreal miscues give F1 rivals hope for rest of 2025
content: Sunday's Canadian GP was the first podium in 2025 that didn't feature a McLaren. Is the tide about to turn on F1's runaway leader?

title: 'India will never accept mediation': PM Modi's clear message to Trump
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri clarified that Prime Minister Modi firmly stated India's consistent rejection of third-party mediation, particularly concerning counterterrorism actions like Operation Sindoor in Pakistan. PM Modi emphasized to President Trump that discussions focused on India's anti-terror efforts and conveyed that India views terrorism as an actual war, not a proxy one, with full political unanimity on this stand.

title: 'India now regards terrorism not as proxy war but actual war': PM Modi tells Trump, warns Pak
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received condolences from US President Donald Trump on Wednesday following the Pahalgam terror attack, which tragically resulted in 26 fatalities, according to Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri. The two leaders had planned to engage in bilateral discussions during the G7 summit, but the meeting was canceled due to President Trump's shortened trip to Canada.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: Tehran fires hypersonic missile - 10 key points
content: Tensions escalate as Iran confirms using hypersonic missiles against Israel, prompting a stern warning from President Trump, who hints at knowing Ayatollah Khamenei's location. Khamenei vows retaliation, rejecting mercy for Israel. Trump rebuffed an Israeli plan to eliminate Khamenei, fearing further destabilization, while the US military repositions forces amid evacuation concerns.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos-Sanchez wedding: Venice Mayor says 'I am ashamed'
content: Jeff Bezos's upcoming Venice wedding has sparked controversy, dividing residents. While city officials, like Mayor Luigi Brugnaro, welcome the event for its economic benefits and visibility, some locals protest, expressing resentment towards the mega-wedding. The "No Space for Bezos" collective voiced their opposition, highlighting the city's struggle to balance its historical identity with modern tourism.

title: Your locker may be sealed! Haven’t signed updated agreement? Here’s what banks may do
content: Customers with bank lockers risk losing access if they don't sign revised rental agreements, with about 20% facing potential denial due to missed deadlines. Banks are seeking authorization to issue final notices and seal lockers for non-compliance, as the RBI monitors adherence to updated guidelines.

title: Gold price prediction 24 karat India: Where is rate headed amidst Iran-Israel tensions?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are volatile due to Middle East tensions and speculation about Federal Reserve rate cuts. Gold has surpassed the euro as the second-largest reserve asset, fueled by central bank buying. Focus remains on geopolitical events and upcoming Fed meetings, which will influence gold's trajectory, while domestic demand in India is currently subdued.

title: IND vs ENG: Coffee, selfies, window seat fight, India players get nostalgic
content: On their train ride to Leeds for the first Test, Indian cricketers shared fond childhood memories of train travel. A BCCI video captured their nostalgia, fan interactions, and light-hearted moments, highlighting personal stories from Washington Sundar, Dhruv Jurel, Sai Sudharsan, and Shardul Thakur.

title: Amazon layoffs to continue; CEO Andy Jassy to employees: I could go on, but you get the idea
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy has warned employees that the company's corporate workforce will shrink in the coming years due to the integration of AI tools across its operations. Jassy emphasized the need for employees to adapt and embrace AI to remain relevant, as Amazon deploys generative AI across various business units, aiming for efficiency gains and innovation.

title: 'Nations that openly support terrorism rewarded': PM Modi slams double standards
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the G7 Outreach Session in Kananaskis, urging world leaders to unite against terrorism and eliminate double standards. He emphasized holding countries accountable for supporting terrorism and called for strict action against those who promote it. PM Modi also engaged in productive discussions with several leaders, focusing on strengthening trade ties and addressing global challenges.

title: Exclusive | 'England will target Gill... try and knock him over': Nick Knight
content: Former England batter Nick Knight anticipates an intriguing India-England Test series, despite the absence of key players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Knight believes that India's emerging talents, such as Sai Sudharsan, are ready for international cricket.

title: 'The battle begins': Iran's Khamenei hits back at Trump's threats; US may join strikes
content: Tensions escalate as Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei declares “the battle begins” following threats from US President Trump. Iran launched ballistic missiles at Israel, prompting retaliatory airstrikes in Tehran and Karaj. Israel's military campaign aims to dismantle Iran's nuclear and missile programs.

title: Elon Musk warns of ‘America bankruptcy’; says all tax revenue will go to paying…
content: Elon Musk has cautioned about the US economy, suggesting potential bankruptcy if the national debt crisis isn't addressed. He highlighted that a significant portion of tax revenue is allocated to interest payments on the $37 trillion national debt. Musk's concerns echo previous warnings about the escalating debt and its implications for the nation's financial stability.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 below 24,850; BSE Sensex dips over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was below 24,850, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: Chess | Fabiano Caruana takes a dig at D Gukesh - 'not scary yet'
content: Fabiano Caruana has downplayed the hype around India’s young chess stars, saying Gukesh and Arjun Erigaisi aren’t "scary" opponents yet. Despite their rise, Caruana believes the likes of Magnus, Hikaru, and Aronian still hold the edge, suggesting the generational shift in chess isn’t happening just yet.

title: Air India snag strands flyers overnight in Delhi airport; Union minister among passengers
content: Air India flight AI-2489 from Delhi to Bhubaneswar was grounded Tuesday night due to a technical snag, leaving passengers stranded for hours at Delhi's IGI Airport. Union Minister Jual Oram and Dr. Subrat Acharya were among those affected. Passengers, including women and children, waited at Terminal 3 with no confirmed alternate flight.

title: 'Nahi chahiye biryani!': Shastri reveals chat that angered Shami; resulted in heroics
content: Ravi Shastri and Bharat Arun revealed that Mohammed Shami's anger over biryani fueled a match-winning performance against South Africa in 2018. During lunch on the fourth day of the final Test, Shastri noticed Shami with a large serving of biryani. Shami, angered by the comment, rejected the biryani and went on to take a five-wicket haul, securing India's victory.

title: Axiom-4 launch delayed again: NASA cites space station repairs
content: The Axiom-4 mission, featuring India's Shubhanshu Shukla, has been further delayed and is now targeted for launch on June 22. This postponement allows NASA additional time to assess space station operations following recent repair work on the International Space Station's Evezda service module. The mission was initially scheduled for May 29 before being moved to June 8.

title: US shuts Jerusalem embassy; no evacuation for Americans announced
content: Amid escalating military tensions between Iran and Israel, the United States will close its embassy in Jerusalem from Wednesday through Friday. This decision follows missile strikes in Jerusalem and Tel Aviv, with minor damage reported near the US Embassy's Tel Aviv branch.

title: IND vs ENG: Hussain makes bold prediction, says India will miss Rohit, Virat
content: Nasser Hussain has dismissed India’s chances in the upcoming Test series, citing the absence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Predicting a 3-1 win for England, he emphasized home advantage as the key factor favouring Ben Stokes’ side.

title: 'Suryavanshi doesn't eat anymore': Father; Dravid advices him to stay away from ...
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old, is making waves in the IPL. Rajasthan Royals selected him. He became the youngest centurion. Prime Minister Narendra Modi encouraged him. Concerns arose about his weight. Rahul Dravid is guiding him. Suryavanshi is training with the India Under-19 team in the UK. The cricket community is watching his progress.

title: DU UG admission 2025: Phase 1 registration begins at ugadmission.uod.ac.in
content: Delhi University has opened its UG admission portal for the 2025-26 academic session through CSAS(UG)-2025, requiring CUET (UG) 2025 scores. Phase 1 registration is now live, with Phase 2 to follow post-CUET results in July. New features include Class 10 marks as a tie-breaker and an auto-accept option. DU is offering 79 UG programmes across 69 colleges. Admissions to skill-based, law, BTech, and SOL courses are also underway. Application is online via ugadmission.uod.ac.in.

title: PM Modi, Carney bury hatchet: New envoys designated; diplomatic services to resume soon
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney at the G7 Summit, agreeing to appoint new high commissioners to restore regular services for citizens and businesses. Modi praised Carney for hosting the summit and expressed India's commitment to strengthening ties based on shared values.

title: 'Absurd mentality': Ex-England cricketer trolled for calling India Tests 'warm-up for Ashes'
content: Graeme Swann's controversial remarks, labeling the India-England Test series as a mere 'warm-up for the Ashes,' have ignited criticism. Fans and pundits view this as disrespectful to India's cricketing prowess. Despite India missing key players like Kohli and Rohit, the series promises a high-stakes contest with emerging talents and experienced players ready to make their mark.

title: Air India pilot's last words haunt neighbours, says goodbye to Cap Sumeet Sabharwal
content: Captain Sumeet Sabharwal's remains arrived in Mumbai, mourned by family, friends, and aviation colleagues who remembered him as a thorough gentleman and ace pilot. His final flight, AI171, crashed on takeoff. The remains of cabin officer Aparna Mahadik reached Goregaon, while air hostess Maithili Patil was cremated in Navi Mumbai, highlighting the tragic loss felt across the aviation community.

title: 'Need to be careful': Canadian PM Carney shifts posture on Nijjar case
content: During the G7 Summit, Canadian PM Mark Carney addressed the Hardeep Singh Nijjar case, emphasizing the need for law enforcement cooperation with India while respecting the ongoing judicial process. Tensions have been high since 2023, following allegations of Indian involvement in Nijjar's killing, which India has vehemently denied.

title: SSC GD result 2025 declared at ssc.gov.in, check cut-off marks and download PDF
content: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has declared the SSC GD Constable result 2025 on June 17, 2025, at SSC.gov.in. Candidates who appeared for the online exam held from February 4 to 25 can now check their results, cut-off marks, and merit list without login. The recruitment aims to fill 53,690 vacancies. The result PDF is downloadable directly, and the final answer key and scorecards will be released shortly.

title: Ex-MLB star Zack Cozart says he’ll stop supporting President Donald Trump if war breaks out
content: Former MLB All-Star Zack Cozart, a once ardent supporter of Donald Trump, has publicly stated that his support would cease if Trump initiates a war, reflecting growing unease among some Republicans. Cozart's shift comes amid escalating tensions in the Middle East, signaling a potential disillusionment with foreign entanglements over domestic priorities.

title: ‘Sonam’s signal led to Raja's murder’: Cops reconstruct crime scene
content: Police reconstructed the crime scene in Shillong. Sonam Raghuvanshi and her accomplices murdered her husband, Raja. The couple was on their honeymoon in Sohra. Sonam's lover, Raj Singh Kushwaha, and his friends were involved. Sonam signaled the group to commit the crime. Raja was attacked with machetes. The body was thrown into a gorge.

title: Plane shortage grounds Air India's Ahmedabad-London flight
content: Air India faced disruptions with flight cancellations, including the Ahmedabad-London Gatwick route, due to aircraft unavailability stemming from airspace restrictions in West Asia and intensified safety checks following a recent Dreamliner crash. Nine international flights were grounded, primarily involving Boeing 787-8 Dreamliners, due to these factors and a snag with a Boeing 777.

title: Centre-TN dispute over Keeladi find claims 1st victim: ASI director shunted
content: The Union government has removed Amarnath Ramakrishna as ASI director (antiquity) after disagreements over the dating of Keeladi archaeological finds. Ramakrishna's report suggested the finds were from the 8th century BCE, a claim disputed by the Union culture minister and another ASI director, Hemasagar A Naik, who will now head the antiquities department.

title: TOI Social Impact Summit to honour breakout work in CSR-ESG
content: CSR, since its 2014 inception, has expanded significantly, with businesses actively investing in social impact. ESG is gaining traction, emphasizing environment, social factors, and governance. The Times of India will host a Social Impact Summit on July 11-12, 2025, in Mumbai, presented by Malabar Gold & Diamonds, with Ernst & Young as knowledge partner.

title: 12 out of 25 girls from one UP Sarvodaya school crack NEET
content: Daughters of laborers and farmers in Uttar Pradesh, facing economic hardship, have defied odds by cracking NEET, the national medical entrance exam. Twelve girls from Sarvodaya Vidyalaya in Mirzapur, a school for underprivileged students, achieved this feat through free residential coaching.

title: Who was Anne Burrell? Celebrity chef and TV host who died at 55
content: Chef and television personality Anne Burrell has passed away at her home in Brooklyn at the age of 55. Known for her vibrant personality and culinary expertise, she was a Food Network staple, hosting 'Worst Cooks in America' and appearing on other shows. Burrell's influence extended beyond television through her cookbooks and charitable work.

title: 'Housefull 5' Box Office collection day 12: Akshay Kumar's film crosses Rs 160cr mark
content: Housefull 5, starring Akshay Kumar, Abhishek Bachchan, and Riteish Deshmukh, continues its successful run at the box office, earning over Rs. 4 crore on its second Tuesday. The film has surpassed Rs. 160 crore, reaching a total of Rs. 162.15 crore after 12 days. Directed by Tarun Mansukhani, the movie features a large ensemble cast, contributing to its popularity.

title: How Iran’s Khamenei lost his top commanders and why his axis is crumbling
content: The deaths weren’t just symbolic—they were surgical. The head of the Revolutionary Guards. The architect of Iran’s missile programme. The chief of military intelligence. The coordinator of national defence. Gone. One by one, the core of Khamenei’s advisory ring has been eliminated, shattering the command-and-control structure he built over three decades.

title: 'Extreme thuggery': NYC mayoral candidate Brad Lander arrested at court; watch video
content: New York City Comptroller Brad Lander, a Democratic mayoral candidate, was arrested at a Manhattan immigration court after linking arms with a man federal agents were attempting to detain. Agents arrested Lander for allegedly assaulting law enforcement and impeding a federal officer. Released after a few hours, Lander insisted he did not assault anyone and was there to support immigrants.

title: Can't stop Kamal film screening due to threat of mob violence: SC
content: The Supreme Court intervened in the 'Thug Life' film screening issue. It stated that rule of law is paramount, not public sentiment. Karnataka cannot allow mobs to obstruct a CBFC-cleared film. The court transferred Kamal Haasan's petition to itself. It asked the state government to respond to a PIL. Freedom of speech must be protected, the court noted.

title: Israel-Iran: Trump may consider joining Israel in striking Iran's nuke sites; report claims
content: President Trump is considering US involvement in Israel's strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, hinting at potential support amid escalating tensions. He has expressed a desire for Iran's "UNCONDITIONAL SURRENDER!" and suggested the US has the capability to target key Iranian figures.

title: British Navy's F-35 still stuck in Kerala, CISF posts man to guard it
content: A British Royal Navy F-35 fighter jet remains grounded at Thiruvananthapuram airport following an emergency landing on Saturday night due to a hydraulic system malfunction. The aircraft, operating from the HMS Prince of Wales, situated off the Kerala coast, faced further delays despite initial repairs.

title: Meghalaya still a safe destination: Conrad
content: Following the tragic murder of a tourist, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma has announced enhanced security measures, including a real-time distress response system via a tourism app and a 'tourist buddy' scheme. The state is also enforcing carrying capacity norms and developing new tourism circuits to boost visitor experience.

title: Melodi moment: PM Modi meets Meloni at G7 in Canada; both leaders reaffirm growing ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni met at the G7 Summit in Canada, reaffirming the strong friendship between Italy and India. Their interactions, including a selfie at COP28 and viral moments at the G20 summit, have garnered public attention. Both leaders have expressed a commitment to strengthening cooperation in sustainable development, energy, and industry.

title: Trump’s Iran choice: Bunker-busting bomb or the phone; Tehran on edge
content: President Trump faces a critical decision regarding Iran: intervene militarily by targeting the Fordo nuclear site, potentially derailing nuclear talks and igniting a broader conflict. Israel's escalating strikes on Tehran and Netanyahu's demands for eliminating Iran's nuclear capabilities intensify the pressure. Trump weighs diplomatic options against the threat of force, navigating conflicting advice from allies and political factions.

title: Survey of AI's 787 fleet found no major safety issue: DGCA
content: The DGCA has expressed concerns over Air India's recent maintenance issues, leading to flight delays and cancellations. The regulator directed Air India to prioritize safety, improve internal coordination, and ensure adequate spare parts availability. A meeting was convened with Air India's leadership to review operations and compliance with safety regulations.

title: Mamata Banerjee's new OBC list also hits high court hurdle
content: The Calcutta High Court has temporarily suspended the West Bengal government's revised OBC list, which included 140 sub-groups, citing procedural irregularities under the West Bengal Commission for Backward Classes Act, 1993. This decision halts the implementation of the new list and related orders until July 31, pending a Supreme Court hearing.

title: "Sonam Ran Away After Hitman...": New Details In Honeymoon Murder Case
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi ran away after Vishal Singh Chauhan - one of the hitmen hired by her - struck her newly-wed husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, with a machete for the first time, police said.

title: Air India Plane Crash: 184 DNA Matches Confirmed
content: Gujarat Home Minister Harsh Sanghavi on Wednesday announced that 184 DNA samples have been matched so far after the tragic London-bound Air India plane crash.

title: Iran's 'Oppenheimer' Silenced: Inside Top Nuclear Scientist's Murder
content: When Israeli missiles rained on Iran's nuclear facilities this month, Fereidoun Abbasi, the former head of Iran's Atomic Energy Organisation, was among the high-profile casualties.

title: Married UP Woman Jumps Off Hotel Roof After Being Caught With Lover
content: A married woman jumped off the roof of a hotel and fled after her husband allegedly caught her with another man in a room in Baraut town of Baghpat district of Uttar Pradesh.

title: Israel-Iran Attacks LIVE: "Battle Begins," Says Khamenei As Iran Launches Hypersonic Missile At Israel
content: Israel-Iran Conflict Day 6 LIVE Updates: The deadly conflict between Iran and Israel entered its sixth day on Wednesday, with both sides widening their attacks.

title: World's Most Expensive Fighter Jet Is Still Grounded In Kerala. This Is Why
content: A British Royal Navy F-35B stealth fighter jet remains grounded at Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram International Airport more than 72 hours after it was forced to make an emergency landing.

title: Israel's Mossad Used AI, Smuggled-In Drones To Plan Attack On Iran
content: Israel stunned and hobbled Iran last week when it pulled off an intelligence and military operation years in the making that struck high-level targets with precision.

title: 5 Things PM Modi Told Donald Trump In 35-Minute Phone Call
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday held a telephonic conversation with US President Donald Trump and discussed the issue of terrorism, hours before the latter's scheduled meeting with Pakistan's Army Chief.

title: MK Stalin To Launch Fifty Water Vending Machines In Chennai
content: In a major public welfare initiative to ensure access to clean drinking water for all, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin will inaugurate 50 vending machines across Chennai on Wednesday.

title: "No Mercy," Says Khamenei As Iran Launches Hypersonic Missile At Israel: 10 Points
content: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has issued a battle cry as Tehran used hypersonic missiles to pound Israel in the latest round of overnight strikes as the fighting moved into its sixth day.

title: Trump To Meet Pak Army Chief Asim Munir, Days After US Denied Parade Invite
content: US President Donald Trump will meet Pakistan's Army Chief, General Syed Asim Munir, who is in Washington on an official visit. The reports about the meeting came days after the White House denied inviting Munir to the US Army Day celebrations.

title: Iran Asks Citizens To Delete WhatsApp, Cites Israel Link. Company Responds
content: Iranian state television on Tuesday afternoon urged people to remove WhatsApp from their smartphones, alleging without specific evidence that the messaging app gathered user information to send to Israel.

title: Big Breakthrough In India-Canada Ties, Months After Diplomatic Fallout
content: India and Canada agreed on Tuesday to reinstate ambassadors to each other's capitals, months after the bitter diplomatic fallout between New Delhi and Ottawa.

title: Indian-Origin Engineer Anantha Chandrakasan Named MIT Provost
content: Prof Anantha Chandrakasan has been named Massachusetts Institute of Technology's new provost, the first Indian-American to serve in this leadership role.

title: US Spies Denied Iran Was Building Nuclear Weapon. "Don't Care," Said Trump
content: Trump's statement aligned him more closely with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who has described a nuclear-armed Iran as an imminent threat, than with his own top intelligence adviser.

title: Maharashtra To Double Honorarium Amount For Emergency Prisoners
content: The Maharashtra cabinet has decided to double the honorarium provided by the state government to those imprisoned during the Emergency in 1975.

title: Italy's Giorgia Meloni Posts Pic With PM Modi At G7 Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni on the sidelines of the 51st G7 Summit in Kananaskis, Canada.

title: Sikkim's Unique Time Capsule 2025 To Leave A Message For Future Generation
content: The Himalayan state of Sikkim has launched a unique initiative in the form of a Time Capsule 2025 to mark five decades of statehood.

title: Live Updates: India, Canada To Reinstate High Commissioners, Months After Diplomatic Fallout
content: PM Modi is in Canada to attend the annual G7 Summit. He said he would be discussing important global issues and highlight the issues of the Global South at the international forum.

title: INDIA bloc intact; SP-Congress to contest U.P. polls together, says Akhilesh

content: Councillors allege that CSML has not taken any steps for maintenance, though the relocated LED lights have been facing problems from day one

content: Researchers have found that the colourful pigment extracted from the lac insect may be produced by a symbiotic yeast-like organism living inside the insect

title: Injustice against women will not be tolerated: NCW member

title: Community-run irrigation canals revived in Assam
content: In areas near the Bhutan border, the Dong system diverts river water through earthen canals to fill ponds for household and farming needs

content: The Bill aims to regulate the licensing process of clinical establishments, increase transparency in functioning, ensure adherence to rates, and mandate electronic medical record-keeping

title: Farmers request Udhayanidhi to order removal of all seemai karuvelam trees from Vaigai

title: Shaquille O'Neal to join WWE 2K25 roster with Tyrese Haliburton
content: The next DLC pack for WWE 2K25 is just over a week away, and the second of the mystery NBA stars being added to the game has been revealed. Shaquille O'Neal will join  Tyrese Haliburton  in the "Dunk & Destruction Pack." Shaq has had a lot of involvement in the pro-wrestling world over the years. Back in 2016, he was a surprise competitor at WrestleMania 32's Andre the Giant Memorial Battle Royal, where his massive 7-foot-1 frame stood up to the equally huge Big Show. Then in 2021, Shaq turned to AEW, competing in a tag team match with the then-debuting Jade Cargill against company founder Cody Rhodes and Red Velvet. Alongside Shaq, Haliburton and the one NBA star yet to be announced, this DLC pack features The Great Khali, a former world champion in WWE, and Abyss, a former TNA wrestler who now works as a backstage producer for WWE. It is scheduled to release on June 25, 2025.

title: Don't be surprised if ... these 19 things happen in 2025
